1570989643_1HFbnmQ8wBoYBNqZy2wVfyLg19v4W.body: I can't connect to anyone yet :(

1610847074_1MnhVCwvyZSAo62TPm5vV4Q9f34iJ.body: Hi uwnz! I'm up for this. What platforms do you fancy using? I use Jami and Tox, but am willing to try others.

1610754180_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_777_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): I would personally look at xmpp, matrix, briar, jami, and tox (not for serious stuff though). All open source, most are very well developed, and all but tox use well tested e2e encryption. You also aren't locked into a particular client with all but jami and briar.

Yes. Offline messaging is still difficult with decentralized messaging it seems. There was a long discussion at rc3 with the devs about this, as I feel this is one of the main reasons these decentralized chat networks never get enough users to make it worth jumping ship from a centrallized one. I could be wrong, but it's the main reason why I don't push them more with my friends.
Briar would be great for demonstrations etc as you don't need internet access, but I haven't used it properly as until recently you had to be physically with someone to add them to your contacts list (for security reasons mainly, but of course that makes things difficult for the less-paranoid!).
I should try briar again.

> [test123a](#comment_36_13VzYLsme2nhQhPP21jnT2b3WxZbsySzGQ): https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-UlA4-tslROBDS9IqHalWVztqZo7uxlCeKPQ-8uoFOU/htmlview

Great comparison, if it's your sheet, Tox does have a server you can run to act as a relay. I run one myself.
